channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: See map. Inside flower beds, 31st January
item.description:
Bottles

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street cleaning - Grass verges / Shrub beds - Littering

item.title: More than 50 potholes most over 3" deep and adjacent to zebra crossings on the access fro the car park to the hospital entrance, 31st January
item.description:
Potholes and irregular road surface along the entire stretch of Stadium road between Baker Road and Charlton church lane - the majority of the larger potholes are over 3" deep and are located outside the carparks and the entrance to the hospital, adjacent to the zebra crossings, the road itself at these points is also in poor condition with wheel ruts and undulations all presenting trip and fall hazards, given this is the main route from the car park to the hospital where people with disabilities are having to walk is totally unnacceptable also ambulances are having to use this route and crashing into the potholes with patients aboard - this along with the continual flooding at the north end of Stadium Rd as the gullies are blocked is all totally unnacceptable and needs fixing before there is a serious accident either with a car or pedestrians please fix it before someone is seriously injured
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stadium Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Abandoned and broken lime bike. They don't even work in Bromley so...

item.title: Constant over flowing bins, 31st January
item.description:
These are never emptied, someone clears the overflow , never empties the bins. A constant mess. Why arent the council sorting this out!!??

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bridge Gardens, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overturned bin, 31st January
item.description:
This litter bin is always overflowing with rubbish. The litter is scattered around. We think that people overturn it on purpose. We have seen people looking for something into the bin, perhaps they hide drugs in it? Please you have to clean the rubbish and remove the bin, as this is an ongoing issue.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 227 Camden High Street, 31st January
item.description:
The Council invested £££ in a drainage system for the “Square”on the pedestrianised part of Camden High Street - with ducting along the sides of the road under a raised road surface. This has drain inlets at each end. The drain inlet or the ducting itself is blocked. There is permanent and deep standing water across half of the roadway. The drainage system is not fit for purpose This is a major issue for pedestrians who generally don’t wear wellingtons or waders to visit Camden. If (when) we have a cold snap this will freeze and become a safety risk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 227, Camden High Street, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hendon way towards finchley road, 31st January
item.description:
At the traffic lights, right lane, there is a deep pothole, trying to avoid will cause vehicles in the right lane to swerve into the middle lane and will cause an accdident or vehicle damage. please fix.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hendon Way, Brent Cross, Greater London

item.title: Next to zebra crossing, 31st January
item.description:

item.title: Missed General Waste & Recycling Collection, 31st January
item.description:
The general waste and recycling bins are currently overflowing and unable to accept any more rubbish. This has been a recurring problem, with collections being missed for up to three weeks at a time. The attached image shows the bins filled to capacity for the past two weeks. This situation could potentially attract pests that pose a health risk to the residents in the vicinity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dillwyn Close, Perry Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole in very dangerous position on very busy road., 31st January
item.description:
The pothole is very large and deep and will cause a nasty accident if not dealt with soon. It has been there a long time and it is imperative that it is dealt with as a matter of urgency. It is a very busy road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Tudor Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
